message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is about creating a neural network model for query-based abstractive summarization. The task involves summarizing documents with respect to a query, which has applications in search engines. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also involves training a pointer-generator model using a dataset of news article summaries, which suggests a possible sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Additionally, the use of neural networks for summarization indicates possible sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the construction of a neural network model for more targeted summaries using queries, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
